questions.question: Which of the following would contribute the most to sea level rise?

choices.answer: Melting of the Arctic sea ice
Melting of land ice in Greenland and Antarctica
Melting of the glaciers in the Himalayas
Melting of the glaciers in Alaska

imageMetadata.resources:
Photo courtesy of Flickr 
Author: go_greener_oz 
Description: One prediction of where rising sea levels will end up at Cottesloe Beach, Perth Western Australia.

questions.question: Which answer best describes the North Pole?

choices.answer: Ice more than a mile thick over land
Mainly a rocky mountainous landscape
Ice a few feet or yards thick floating over a deep ocean
A small village where several hundred people live

questions.question: Over the last 30 years, the late summer sea ice covering the Arctic Ocean:

choices.answer: Covers more area than it did 30 years ago
Declined, but has recovered to where it was 30 years ago
Has completely disappeared in the summer
Covers less area than it did 30 years ago

questions.question: Albedo is a measure of surface reflectivity. The polar albedo is important because:

choices.answer: It reflects greenhouse gases, cooling our planet
It absorbs solar radiation, which melts snow
It reflects solar radiation back into space, cooling earth
It absorbs greenhouse gases, pulling them out of circulation

questions.question: People describe Alaska as having “drunken trees” because:

choices.answer: Many Alaskan trees grow in bogs soaking in fermented juices
Trees tip as nitrates in the soil convert to "laughing gas"
Trees tip from buckling of the ground due to permafrost thaw
Arctic hare have gnawed away tree roots for winter nutrition

questions.question: Antarctica’s Adelie penguin are negatively impacted by Earth's warming climate because:

choices.answer: Loss of sea ice near the peninsula affects their food, krill
Rain falls instead of snow, freezing the feathers of chicks
Warming causes chicks to hatch before food is available
All answer choices are accurate

imageMetadata.resources:
Photo courtesy of Wikimedia Commons 
Author: Andrew Shiva

questions.resources:
Photo courtesy of Wikimedia Commons 
Author: Andrew Shiva

questions.question: An important example of a "positive feedback loop” in the polar climate system is:

choices.answer: Scientists in remote places check on each others instruments
Warming ocean water opens new areas for marine species
Warmer winters cause more plant growth, providing more food
Sea ice melt opens more ocean to sunlight, causing more melt

imageMetadata.resources:
Photo courtesy of Margie Turrin
Edits made by Laurel Zaima

questions.resources:
Photo courtesy of Margie Turrin
Edits made by Laurel Zaima

questions.question: The polar regions are often decribed as the planet’s refrigerator; this means that:

choices.answer: They cool the planet by radiating heat back into space.
The local residents can store food in the cellar all year
Their cool temperatures keep crops fresh for weeks
Animals live longer because the climate is so cold outside

questions.question: Walrus in the Arctic are suffering from the loss of sea ice because they:

choices.answer: Use the sea ice as a platform for resting
All answer choices are accurate
Launch from sea ice to hunt for food on the ocean bottom
Drift on sea ice to find the ~5000 clams they eat each day

questions.question: What evidence do we have of climate change in the polar regions?

choices.answer: The ice flows faster, is retreating, & surfaces have dropped
Trees are growing all over Antarctica & Greenland now
From space we can see straight through the thinning ice
Both poles have large increases in species diversity

questions.question: How much would global sea level rise if the Greenland & Antarctic ice sheets completely melted?

choices.answer: From 10 to 15 feet
Almost 100 feet
From 20 to 25 feet
Over 200 feet

questions.question: Why is the Antarctic Circumpolar Current important to the world’s climate?

choices.answer: It redistributes temperature & salt throughout the ocean
All answer choices are accurate
It drives CO2 gas exchange with the atmosphere
Density differences make it the "mixer of the deep oceans"

questions.question: Satellites & instruments on the land & sea measure how the poles are warming.

choices.answer: True
False
